answers.answer: You have to find out if it is connected to some central nervous problem or local problem in your legs. Sometimes if there is some problem with the lower spine you have this pain in the legs etc. Consult a neurologist and follow up as you have this since a month. Also go for tests to detect Diabetes & Hypertension. Immediate pain relief take some pain killers along with multivitamin . Take care!

question: I am a 36 year old female.  I have been experiencing severe pain in my feet.  The pain started in my toes, worked up to my feet, up my shins and is now in my knees as well.  The pain is so severe it hurts to walk and at times I can barely stand it.  I have also experienced some pain shooting down my arms and just the last few weeks, I have experienced 4 episodes of disorientation.  They are brief, probably around 1 minute, but I cannot remember what I just did, or twice, where I am.The doctor prescribed gabapentin, then cymbalta for my feet and leg issues, but they have not helped and the symptoms have worsened.I would appreciate any response from a physician.
title: Pain and tingling in feet, episodes of disorientation
